qahramon

Class Armor

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Item
      • qahramon.Armor

  • public class Armor
extends Item
    A class of armors as special kinds of items involving a protection and full protection.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariants:
  • Each armor must have a valid full protection.
        isValidFullProtection(getFullProtection())
  • Each armor must have a valid protection.
        canHaveAsProtection(getProtection())
  • Each item must have a valid full value.
        canHaveAsFullValue(getFullValue())

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Armor(long identification, int protection, float weight, int fullValue)
      Create armor with given identification, protection, weight and fullValue.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Armor

        public Armor(long identification,
             int protection,
             float weight,
             int fullValue)
        Create armor with given identification, protection, weight and fullValue.
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification of this armor
        protection - the full protection and current protection of this armor
        weight - the weight of this armor
        fullValue - the maximum value of this armor
        Precondition:
        The given protection must be valid.
            isValidFullProtection(protection)
        Postconditions:
      • Set the current protection to the given value.
            new.getProtection() = protection
      • Set the full protection to the given value.
            new.getFullProtection() = protection
        • Effect:
        The armor is set as an item with given the identification, weight and maximum value.
            super(identification, weight, fullValue)

        @Basic
 @Immutable
 @Raw
public boolean isArmor()
        Check whether this item is an armor.
        Overrides:
        isArmor in class Item
        Returns:
        Always return true since this item is an armor.
            result == true

      • canHaveAsIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is valid.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when this armor can have the given identification number. Return false otherwise.
            result == (MathHelper.isPrime(identification) && identification > 0)

      • canHaveAsNewIdentification

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsNewIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether the given identification is valid and unique.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsNewIdentification in class Item
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given identification is valid and unique. Return false otherwise.
            result == canHaveAsIdentification (identification)    && !armorIds.contains(identification)

      • canHaveAsProtection

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsProtection(int protection)
        Check whether this armor can have the given protection as protection.
        Parameters:
        protection - the protection to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given protection lies between MIN_PROTECTION and its fullProtection. Return false otherwise.
            (protection >= MIN_PROTECTION && protection <= this.getFullProtection())

      • isValidFullProtection

        public static boolean isValidFullProtection(int fullProtection)
        Check whether this armor can have the given fullProtection as fullProtection.
        Parameters:
        fullProtection - the fullProtection to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given fullProtection lies between MIN_FULLPROTECTION and MAX_FULLPROTECTION. Return false otherwise.
            result == (fullProtection >= MIN_FULLPROTECTION && fullProtection <= MAX_FULLPROTECTION)

      • wearOut

        public void wearOut(int amount)
             throws TerminatedException
        Decrease the protection of this armor.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount by which the protection should be decreased
        Preconditions:
      • The given amount has to be positive.
            amount >= 0
      • The protection still has to be valid after the decrease with the given amount.
            canHaveAsProtection(getProtection() - amount)
        • Postcondition:
        The protection of the armor is decreased by the given amount.
            new.getProtection() = this.getProtection() - amount
        Throws:
        TerminatedException - Throws this exception when this armor is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • repair

        public void repair(int amount)
            throws TerminatedException
        Increase the protection of this armor.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount by which the protection should be increased
        Preconditions:
      • The given amount has to be positive.
            amount >= 0
      • The protection still has to be valid after the increase with the given amount.
            canHaveAsProtection(getProtection() + amount)
        • Postcondition:
        The protection of the armor is increased by the given amount.
            new.getProtection() = this.getProtection() + amount
        Throws:
        TerminatedException - Throws this exception when this armor is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • getValue

        @Raw
public int getValue()
        Return the value of the armor.
        Overrides:
        getValue in class Item
        Returns:
        Return the value as its function: highest possible value of the armor times the current protection percentage of the armor.
            result == (int)((float)getFullValue()*((float)getProtection()/(float)getFullProtection()))

      • canHaveAsFullValue

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsFullValue(int value)
        Check whether the given full value is valid.
        Parameters:
        value - the integer checked for its validity
        Returns:
        Return true if the given value lies between the minimum and maximum value and is an even integer. Return false otherwise.
            result == super.canHaveAsValue(value) && value % 2 == 0

      • canHaveAsValue

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsValue(int value)
        Check whether the given value is valid.
        Overrides:
        canHaveAsValue in class Item
        Parameters:
        value - the integer checked for its validity
        Returns:
        Return true if the given value lies between the minimum and maximum value. Return false otherwise.
            result == super.canHaveAsValue(value) && value <= getFullValue()
